lead_paragraph: The Chicago Bears released the former Pro Bowl wide receiver Muhsin Muhammad after three seasons. Chicago also gave defensive end Alex Brown a two-year contract extension. Muhammad, who turns 35 in May, spent nine seasons with the Carolina Panthers and twice made the Pro Bowl. He was released in February 2005 after setting career highs with 1,405 receiving yards and 16 touchdowns. He signed a six-year contract with the Bears, but his numbers dropped dramatically. He caught 40 passes for 570 yards and 3 touchdowns last season.
